frame.name: Relative_time
frame.definition:
<def-root>These words relate to the relative ordering of two events or times. There are two major types of relations evoked by the words of this frame. <ex></ex> Some of the words (e.g. <ment>follow.v, antecedent.a, previous.a</ment>) describe the (definitively) stative relationship between two events (the <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen> and the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen>). This first type will be moved to the Time_vector frame.
<ex><t>After</t> <fex name="Landmark_occasion">she arrived</fex> , <fex name="Focal_occasion">she laid out her papers on the desk</fex>.</ex> <ex>The <t>following</t> <fex name="Focal_occasion">morning</fex>, she tried to figure out what it meant . <fex name="Landmark_occasion">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex></ex> Others (e.g. <ment>belated.a, early.a</ment>) refer to the change or deviation of an event from the <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen> (which is expected or usual at a particular time) to the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> (which occurs at a different time). Quite often, a <fen>Focal_participant</fen> who is saliently involved in the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> stands in for the occasion.
<ex><fex name="Focal_occasion">My flight</fex> is <t>early</t> <fex name="Interval">by 20 minutes</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Focal_participant">I</fex> 'm <t>late</t> <fex name="Landmark_occasion">for my departure</fex> !</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Focal_occasion
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is the event which is being located in time with respect to some other event: The <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is profiled, in contrast to the <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen>, which is backgrounded. <ex><fex name="FEv">Hours of eating and drinking</fex> <t>followed</t> the wedding ceremony.</ex> <ex>Her <t>belated</t> <fex name="Focal_occasion">party</fex> was still a success.</ex> <ex>During the <t>previous</t> <fex name="Focal_occasion">week</fex>, he had eaten 5 mangoes.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Landmark_occasion
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen> is the event with respect to which the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is located. <ex>Hours of eating and drinking <t>followed</t> <fex name="Landmark_occasion">the wedding ceremony</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Interval
FE.definition: <def-root>Frequently, the Interval between the Reference and Focal Occasions is expressed: The article in the Times <fex name="Interval">closely</fex> <t>followed</t> the singer's announcement that he was retiring. </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for the <fen>Explanation</fen> or explanation for the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> being early or late.</def-root>

FE.name: Focal_participant
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Focal_participant</fen> is the participant in the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> which is profiled as being in a relation of relative time to the <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Focal_participant">We</fex> were <t>late</t> <fex name="Landmark_occasion">for dinner</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>
